message_1: A rectangular block of wood with dimensions 0.3 m x 0.2 m x 0.15 m is floating in water. If the density of wood is 700 kg/m³, what is the mass of the block and how much water does it displace? (Density of water is 1000 kg/m³)
message_2:
To find the mass of the block, we can use the formula:

mass = density x volume

First, we need to find the volume of the block:

volume = length x width x height
volume = 0.3 m x 0.2 m x 0.15 m
volume = 0.009 m³

Now we can find the mass of the block:

mass = density x volume
mass = 700 kg/m³ x 0.009 m³
mass = 6.3 kg

Since the block is floating, the weight of the water displaced is equal to the weight of the block. We can use the formula:

weight = mass x gravity
weight = 6.3 kg x 9.81 m/s²
weight = 61.803 kg m/s² (or N, Newtons)

Now we can find the volume of water displaced using the formula:

volume = weight / (density x gravity)
volume = 61.803 N / (1000 kg/m³ x 9.81 m/s²)
volume = 61.803 N / 9810 N/m³
volume ≈ 0.0063 m³

So, the mass of the block is 6.3 kg, and it displaces approximately 0.0063 m³ of water.
